encyclopedia.content: 1. 踢 He kicked the football out of the field. 他把球踢出了场外。 2. 踢进锛埱蛎棚級得分 He kicked a goal. 他踢进了一个球。 3. 锛埱梗诘蕊級朝。..反冲，朝。..后座 4. 【口】戒绝锛埗裣帮級 She decided to kick heroin. 她决心不再服用海洛因了。 5. 【美】【口】拒绝；抛弃 vi. 1. 踢；踢腿 The baby is kicking and crying. 那婴孩正又踢又叫。 2. 锛埱梗诘蕊級反冲，后座 3. 【口】戒绝恶习 n. 1. 踢 He got the

entry.def: If you kick someone or something, you hit them forcefully with your foot.

example.ex: He threw me to the ground and started to kick...
example.tran: 他把我摔倒在地开始踢我。

entry.def: When you kick a ball or other object, you hit it with your foot so that it moves through the air.

example.ex: I went to kick the ball and I completely missed it...

entry.def: If you kick or if you kick your legs, you move your legs with very quick, small, and forceful movements, once or repeatedly.

example.ex: They were dragged away struggling and kicking...
example.tran: 他们被拖走时挣扎着又踢又蹬。

example.ex: First he kicked the left leg, then he kicked the right...
example.tran: 他先踢左腿，然后踢右腿。

entry.def: If you kick your legs, you lift your legs up very high one after the other, for example when you are dancing.

example.ex: He was kicking his legs like a Can Can dancer...
example.tran: 他像跳康康舞一样踢着腿。

example.ex: She begins dancing, kicking her legs high in the air.
example.tran: 她开始跳舞，做了空中高踢腿动作。

entry.def: If you kick a habit, you stop doing something that is bad for you and that you find difficult to stop doing.

example.ex: She's kicked her drug habit and learned that her life has value...
example.tran: 她已经戒了毒，并且认识到了生命可贵。

example.ex: I've kicked cigarettes, heroin, and booze.
example.tran: 我已经戒了烟，不再吸食海洛因和酗酒了。

entry.tran: 极度兴奋；极度刺激；极大的乐趣
entry.def: If something gives you a kick, it makes you feel very excited or very happy for a short period of time.

example.ex: I got a kick out of seeing my name in print.
example.tran: 当看到我的名字印成铅字时，我感到无比兴奋。

entry.def: If you say that someone kicks you when you are down, you think they are behaving unfairly because they are attacking you when you are in a weak position.

example.ex: In the end I just couldn't kick Jimmy when he was down.
example.tran: 最后我就是无法做到在吉米倒霉时落井下石。

entry.def: If you say that someone does something for kicks, you mean that they do it because they think it will be exciting.

example.ex: They made a few small bets for kicks.
example.tran: 他们觉得好玩便小赌了几把。

entry.def: If you say that someone is dragged kicking and screaming into a particular course of action, you are emphasizing that they are very unwilling to do what they are being made to do.

example.ex: He had to be dragged kicking and screaming into action.
example.tran: 他要被强拉硬拽才肯行动起来。

entry.tran: 令人极度失望的事；重大的挫折
entry.def: If you describe an event as a kick in the teeth, you are emphasizing that it is very disappointing and upsetting.

example.ex: We've been struggling for years and it's a real kick in the teeth to see a new band make it ahead of us.
example.tran: 我们奋斗了多年，看到一支新的乐队反而超越了我们，真让人大失所望。

entry.tran: 我真生自己的气/ 你会感到懊恼的
entry.def: You use kick yourself in expressions such as I could have kicked myself and you're going to kick yourself to indicate that you were annoyed or are going to be annoyed that you got something wrong.

example.ex: I was still kicking myself for not paying attention...
example.tran: 我仍在怪自己没有注意。

example.ex: I immediately regretted having said this— I could have kicked myself.
example.tran: 我一说完这话就后悔了——我都想抽自己。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of delivering a blow with the foot;

sentences.sentence: "he gave the ball a powerful kick"

means.word_mean: 2. the swift release of a store of affective force;

sentences.sentence: "they got a great bang out of it"
"he got a quick rush from injecting heroin"

means.word_mean: 3. the backward jerk of a gun when it is fired

sentences.sentence: "I have a gripe about the service here"

means.word_mean: 5. the sudden stimulation provided by strong drink (or certain drugs);

sentences.sentence: "a sidecar is a smooth drink but it has a powerful kick"

means.word_mean: 6. a rhythmic thrusting movement of the legs as in swimming or calisthenics;

sentences.sentence: "the kick must be synchronized with the arm movements"
"the swimmer's kicking left a wake behind him"

means.word_mean: 1. drive or propel with the foot
2. thrash about or strike out with the feet
5. spring back, as from a forceful thrust;

sentences.sentence: "The gun kicked back into my shoulder"
"He kicked the extra point after touchdown"

means.word_mean: 8. express complaints, discontent, displeasure, or unhappiness;

sentences.sentence: "She has a lot to kick about"

list.explanation: 挑起事端，引起骚动，大吵大闹，大声抱怨

example.en: I don't want his lawyer to kick up a fuss about this.
example.zh: 我不想让他的律帅对此大动干戈。

example.en: Ernie used to be a kick freak, but all that has changed.
example.zh: 欧尼过去是一个吸毒没有瘾的人，但后来全不是那么回事，都变样了。

example.en: He tried to pick the passengers' prat kicks in a crowded bus.
example.zh: 他千方百计想在一辆拥挤的公共汽车上扒窃乘客的后裤袋。

Sentence.sentence: If you think so, you're not alone, because energy independence has been the dream of American president for decades, and never more so than in the past few years, when the most recent oil price shock has been partly responsible for kicking off the great recession.
There's a stimulative effect that kicks in when women have greater access to jobs and the economic lives of our countries: Greater political stability.

From self-service checkout lines at supermarket to industrial robots armed with saws and taught to carve up animal bodies in slaughter-houses, these ever-more-intelligent machines are now not just assisting workers but actually kicking them out of their jobs.

sentences.en: The baby was kicking and screaming.
The man kicked the door shut.
sentences.cn: 那男人一脚把门踢上了。

sentences.en: He gave the ball a kick.

means.word_mean: 〈非正〉极度兴奋, 快乐，极度刺激，极大的乐趣

sentences.en: I get a big kick from[out of] motor racing.
He has no kick left in him.

jushi.english: If the people are taxed much more, they'll begin to kick.
jushi.chinese: 如果向人民再加重税,他们就开始抱怨了。
小马一边挣扎,一边踢腾。
